channel.title: iwabm on github
channel.description: Recent content on iwabm on github

item.title: INAGEYA
item.description: 2016, Strategic Concept | Professional Work Design Question: What is “beyond” supermarket? In a situation that society and family structures are changing, a role of supermarket also needs to change in Japan. Clients were struggling for planning a strong concept of a next-generation supermarket in 2020 with consideration for a sustainable ecosystem and of course customer-first. Design Thinking: Dive into “the customer” Using IBM Design Thinking, we supported to ideate a brand-new future user experience and defined the concept of next-gen supermarket only in 2 days intensive design camp.

item.title: LimpiDual Touch
item.description: 2009, Interactive Media | Academic Work Design Question: If we can display information on a transparent surface, how will our experience change? Direct-touch input enables intuitive operation, and touch panels have been mounted on various devices. However, finger occlusion becomes one of the problems when a user touches the display from the front side. Here, inspired from SF movies, one idea to solve this problem is to use “transparent” display.

item.title: IBM CSC
item.description: 2014, Pro Bono Consulting | Professional Work Design Question: How do we establish a preferable future vision on a social level? IBM CSC(Corporate Service Corp) is one-month pro bono consulting program for developing countries addressing Energy, Economic Development, Transportation, Education, and Healthcare. I participated in the IBM pro bono Corporate Service Corps, addressing social issues in developing countries. I was one of a cross-border global IBM team in Mexico that sought to tackle the problems of gender violence by collaborating with the Mexico State Public Administration.

item.title: Speculative Thinking
item.description: 2017, Design Process Study Private Work Personal research of the experience design process in the 21st Century Speculative Fusion of Design and Science This is my own thought of the speculative fusion of design and science. In the business field, we have been creating probable futures using industrial solutions. Currently, through a collaboration with designers, technologists and business strategists, we can imagine and develop further plausible futures based on emerging technologies.

item.title: SANJA FESTIVAL
item.description: 2017, Photography Sanja Matsuri (三社祭, literally “Three Shrine Festival”), or Sanja Festival, is one of the three great Shinto festivals in Tokyo. It is considered one of the wildest and largest. The festival is held in honor of the three men who established and founded Sensō-ji. Sanja Matsuri is held on the third weekend of every May at Asakusa Shrine. Its prominent parades revolve around three mikoshi (portable shrines referenced in the festival’s name), as well as traditional music and dancing.

item.title: FICTIONAL REAL, REAL FICTION
item.description: 2016, Photography Facts like fiction and fiction like facts. I am seeking for something on the border of them both. Which side are we living on? Publication EINSTEIN STUDIO ARCHIVES, Compilation book of Japanese young photographers, 2016

item.title: PHOTOGRAPHY 100Y AFTER
item.description: 2016, Photography This is the normal way of life in the 22nd century. Children is playing in a "virtual forest". Are these images our future dreamed life? This is the normal way of life in the 22nd century. I reviewed my lifemoment archives and found my external memory failed to save one second of my life. What will be the difference between our ''memories’’ and ''records‘‘? This is the normal way of life in the 22nd century.

item.title: PHOTOGRAPHY 100Y AFTER
item.description: 2016, Photography | Personal Work Personal Question: What kind of picture do we take 100 years later? This is a private project that comes from questions. This is a speculative and experimental imagination for our future 22nd century. virtual forest This is the normal way of life in the 22nd century. Children is playing in a “virtual forest”. Are these images our future dreamed life? error in my memory This is the normal way of life in the 22nd century.

item.title: IBM STUDIO BOARD
item.description: 2016, Graphic Design | Professional Work Design Question: How do we IBM designers communicate our new design culture to clients? Of course, we respect traditional IBM design philosophy. Additionally, we reflect new IBM design environment and culture. Design and Prototyping Apply to the atmosphere of our Tokyo studio Credit Project contribution: Concept, Develop, Deliver Period: 12/2015 - 01/2016 Role: Graphic Designer Method: Design Thinking Team: Sole Project Release: 01/2016 - until now

item.title: Uber
item.description: 2015, Experience Concept | Academic Work Design Question: How can we improve the experience of Uber drivers? Joined 5 weeks MFA Interaction Design Program of User Research Methods in SVA, US. Woriking in teams, we’ve joined a real project with Uber and proposed UX to solve current issues. I’ve learned the fundamentals of user research techniques and the sense of UX in collaboration with global students. Teacher: Jodi Leo, VP of Product Design at CapTap

item.title: AM3:00, LOWER EAST SIDE
item.description: 2016, Photography AM3:00, midnight landscape in NYC Publication New Japan Photo Exhibition, Midoriso 2, Tokyo, Japan, Mar 2016. New City Art Fair (in EINSTEIN STUDIO booth), hpgrp Gallery, New York, USA, Mar 2016.

item.title: PARSONS SUMMER
item.description: 2015, Graphic Design | Academic Work To be a versatile designer: Learn World-Class Visual Communication Skills To learn basic skills and philosophy of graphic design, I Took 3-weeks Advanced Graphic Design Summer Program in Parsons the new school of Design, US. During intensive 3-weeks project-based course, I delivered 6 projects; Poster Design, Bookjacket Design, Book Design, Timeline Design, App Design and Identity Design. Poster Design Using only type, made a poster which explains how to do something specific.

item.title: ACCURACY OF DEJA-VU
item.description: 2015, Photography Personal Question: Where does the deja-vu feeling come from? Sometimes I feel as if I’ve seen a place that I have visited before. When I had this feeling in Tokyo and Osaka, which are representative cities of the East and West of Japan, I tried to find what made me feel that way.

item.title: Daifuku
item.description: 2015, Corporate Website | Professional Work Design Question: How do we build awareness for a global unified brand? Clients thought their website was becoming obsolete and wanted to enhance their brand using current web technologies and user-centered disciplines. And Daifuku has 20 branches in the world, so they wanted to provide global integrated contents and operations. Service Ecosystem Design Based on a service design approach, we designed and proposed from a business organization to UX / UI and an infrastructure.

item.title: TOKYO CHRISMAS COLLECTION
item.description: 2014, Photography Personal Question: Are Japanese in Tokyo defined by Christmas?

item.title: RAINY DAY TOKYO
item.description: 2013, Photography My nostalgic memories are always in the rain. They are brilliant in my heart forever.
